titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mabel Brady Garvan Institute of American Arts and Crafts, Yale University, Records
Garvan (Mabel Brady) Institute of American Arts and Crafts, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 10:10

did.unittitle: Mabel Brady Garvan Institute of American Arts and Crafts, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of material relating to the study of the Lee plantation conducted by the Mabel Brady Garvan Institute of American Arts and Crafts at Yale. Included are the Stratford survey report, financial records, background materials, correspondence, and subject and administrative files.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Mabel Brady Garvan Institute of American Arts and Crafts

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 37 (YRG 37), Records of associations, institutes, centers, and organizations affiliated with Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the materials is partially restricted. See inventory for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mabel Brady Garvan Institute of American Arts and Crafts, Yale University, Records (RU 561). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of material relating to the study of the Lee plantation conducted by the Mabel Brady Garvan Institute of American Arts and Crafts at Yale. Included are the Stratford survey report, financial records, background materials, correspondence, and subject and administrative files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by accession.

controlaccess.subject: Art museums

Handicraft

Bank statements with vouchers
Check and deposit books
Expense books
BACKGROUND MATERIAL
Ann Carter Lee, second wife of General Henry Lee
I. Five original autographed letters from Ann Carter Lee to members of her family. Rocky Mount collection. Proof read. Photostats made.
II. Birth record of children in Lee Family Bible. Owned by Ann Lee' great-granddaughter, Mrs. Alice Lee Harvie of Richmond, Va. Proof read.
III. Copies of two letters to her son Sydney Smith Lee. Printed in Douglas Freeman's R.E.Lee. Owner: Mrs. Marian Oliver of Shirley. Not photostated.
Charles Carter Lee
Charles Carter Lee
General Henry Lee (Light-Horse Harry Lee)
Typed Copies of original letters and documents found by Ethel Armes in chest at Rocky Mount, Virginia. Proof read. Photostats made.
Major Henry Lee
Typed Copies of his correspondence with his brother, Charles Carter Lee, and others. Some have not been proof read or photostated. Rocky Mount collection.
Major Henry Lee
Major Henry Lee
Major Henry Lee
II. Typed copies of series of letters. Proofread. Photostated. Rocky Mount Collection.
Major Henry Lee
III. Typed copies of series of letters and miscellaneous notes. Proofread. Photostated. Rocky Mount Collection.
Mary Custis Lee (Mrs. Robert E. Lee)
Robert E. Lee
John Leeds material: photostats (from Ethel Armes Collection)
President Roosevelt's foreword to by Ethel Armes, and correspondence with R. Walton Moore, Assistant Secretary of State.
OVERSIZE BACKGROUND MATERIAL PHOTOSTATS AND TYPEWRITTEN COPIES

The Lee Pedigree: Recording the English ancestry of the Virginia Lees. Prepared by H. Edward Forrest, Shrewsbury. Accepted by the College of Heralds, London, England, November 1, 1933, under signature of Arthur Cochrane, Clarencaux, King of Arms.
